comments.content:
i don't know what the font is called.  
does anyone know what the font is called in this picture?

I spent some time looking for this one last night. The main thing is to find the right G. The weight made have been altered by adding black stroke, and then a light offset to outline the lettering.

- Mike Yanega

One that was close, but not exact was [Ronnia Basic Heavy](http://web.archive.org/web/20130719034622/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/type-together/ronnia-basic/) from Type-Together. The S and G would both need tweaking, but it could work, if a better match doesn't show up. Another was [http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/flyer/|Flyer]], which would need work to close the G.

I have not checked freebie fonts, but that might be another possibility. MyFonts was hard to find the combination of a similar G with an open S like this. The 'i' looks like it was flattened to be the same height, hence the flat dot.

Mike Yanega
